@joe_schmoe wrote:

pistolbob:

public void hitDummy();
addSkillXp(i forget what this part is havent changed these in awhile)
sendMessage(You hit the dummy)
addItem(1004)

so do your dummy is a pinata full of money....niiice. I think a cooler thing would be something like...
additem(995+(int)(Math.random() * 6)); //chump change
then every so often (every couple hundred hits or so)....or even just randomly
additem(1004); //jackpot!!!

Although I think you're just spawning a single coin each time you use additem(xxxx) the itemid is just dictating which sprite to use??? Am I right about this?? I haven't really played around much with adding items to inventory.

item.title: {java tut} public voids!
item.dc:creator: @motherload11 motherload11
item.description:
@motherload11 wrote:

public voids are things that can do stuff we call "methods" we/I basicly use them to clean up or make more space in my client/java!
so, what is a public void you ask??

if you search for "dummy" in client.java you get something like this:

public void hitDummy();
addSkillXp(.....)
sendMessage(.....)
addItem(.....)

or something like that lol
well thats a public void!

now lets make an example void:

public void example();
     sendMessage("this is an example public void!");
    creatItem(x,y)
creatItem(4151,1);

now we ganna add method! (or was that thing a method..I forgot! lol)
so heres something like a command that does the public void!

else if (command.StartsWith("example");
{
          example();
}

so in the command you would just put enterPublicVoidNameHere();
its just as simple as that! lol

[move]MoThErLoAd11 OwnS j00[/move]

Read full topic
